intro: Grewia humbertii, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green berries that are edible. The plant has simple, alternate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. The fruit is used in traditional medicine and as a source of food in some regions.
